text:
Just released a beta of <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/pull/371|2.12.0b0> which contains the streaming refactor, using <@UBS7QANF3> benchmark looking at the following improvements:

```# lightweight (2.3x improvement)
#  master: 6.860s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:06<00:00,  1.46it/s])
#  2.12.0: 2.998s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:02<00:00,  3.34it/s])

# Non lightweight (3.4x improvement)
#  master: 36.005s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:35<00:00,  3.60s/it])
#  2.12.0: 10.625s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:10<00:00,  1.06s/it])

# Non lightweight with flumine patching/listener/stream (2.8x improvement)
#  master: 13.896s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:13<00:00,  1.39s/it])
#  2.12.0: 5.005s (100%|██████████| 10/10 [00:04<00:00,  2.00it/s])```
A quick <https://github.com/liampauling/flumine/pull/361|test> on flumine and this equates to around a 2.3x speed improvement which is massive and equates to flumine running through a market faster than the current lightweight implementation! CPU has also halved when running live which is a nice bonus.

Going to stay in beta until I can test this properly in production but I have carried out some regression tests on various markets throughout (hasn't just been optimised for this one market) However feel free to test when backtesting and let me know if there any bugs.

attachments.fallback: [liampauling/betfair] #371 #370 Session timeout updated to 24hrs for international exchange
attachments.title: #371 #370 Session timeout updated to 24hrs for international exchange

text:
problem fixed. the issue was that docker container `openssl.cnf` was missing this section:
```[ ssl_client ]
basicConstraints = CA:FALSE
nsCertType = client
keyUsage = digitalSignature, keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage = clientAuth```
appending it fixes docker login issue

elements.text: problem fixed. the issue was that docker container
openssl.cnf
was missing this section:

[ ssl_client ]
basicConstraints = CA:FALSE
nsCertType = client
keyUsage = digitalSignature, keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage = clientAuth
appending it fixes docker login issue

text: Hi everyone Im new in here. Just started out exploring the betfair api. Im not an experienced programmer either, but do know my basic python, and a bit of api as well. Being from Denmark there is some special things that need to be done. Trying to follow the guide to Non-interactive, but having trouble with the certifications.  Failing for me here: *Create a certificate signing request (CSR..  Also trying one of the scripts from the forum, that should be good to go, but i dont get a ssoid in my response.. Hope someone is able to help and guide me in the right direction.*

text: <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Non-Interactive+%28bot%29+login>

<@U01HY933M9V> if you are from Denmark you can't use certificates/non-interactive logjn, however the <https://liampauling.github.io/betfair/advanced/#nemid-login|code> you found should work, can you try removing any certificates you have uploaded and try again? Are you able to see what the response was from the request? (it should be a 200 with some javascript 'loginStatus' 'SUCCESS' for the redirect)
